sentences: Silmade sulgemine on hea uni jaoks.
context: The word 'silmade' is the partitive plural form of the Estonian word 'silma', which means 'eye'. The partitive case in Estonian often indicates partialness, limitation, or indefiniteness. In this context, 'silmade' can be translated as 'eyes' (referring to multiple eyes) or 'of the eyes' (indicating possession or relation). This form is commonly used when referring to eyes in various contexts such as appearance, vision, or emotional expressions.
